data.text: Success is something you attract by the person you become
data.name: Jim Rohn

data.text: Tread softly; breathe peacefully; laugh hysterically
data.name: Nelson Mandela

data.text: Nothing can be done without hope and confidence
data.name: Dr. Seuss

data.text: You are the average of the five people you spend the most time with
data.name: Jim Rohn

data.text: One important key to success is self-confidence. An important key to self-confidence is preparation.
data.name: Arthur Ashe

data.text: Argue for your limitations and they're yours.
data.name: Richard Bach

data.text: Every noble work is at first impossible.
data.name: Thomas Carlyle

data.text: I destroy my enemies when I make them my friends.
data.name: Abraham Lincoln

data.text: Genius is 1% inspiration, 99% perspiration.
data.name: Thomas Edison

data.text: Sometimes you win, sometimes you learn.
data.name: John Maxwell

data.text: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.
data.name: Frederick Douglass

data.text: To know how to wait is the great secret of success.
data.name: De Maistre

data.text: A Penny Saved is a Penny Earned
data.name: Benjamin Franklin

data.text: It is our attitude toward life that determines life's attitude toward us. We get back what we put out.
data.name: Earl Nightingale

data.text: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
data.name: Pablo Picasso

data.text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.
data.name: Steve Jobs

data.text: I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions.
data.name: Stephen Covey

data.text: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
data.name: Woody Allen

data.text: An unexamined life is not worth living.
data.name: Socrates

data.text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
data.name: Chinese Proverb

data.text: Life is 10% what happens to me and 90% of how I react to it.
data.name: Charles Swindoll

data.text: Life isn't about getting and having, it's about giving and being.
data.name: Kevin Kruse

data.text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.
data.name: Amelia Earhart

data.text: I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took any excuse.
data.name: Florence Nightingale

data.text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
data.name: Wayne Gretzky

data.text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
data.name: Albert Einstein

data.text: Art is one thing that can go on mattering once it has stopped hurting.
data.name: Elizabeth Bowen

data.text: Miracles are not contrary to nature, but only contrary to what we know about nature.
data.name: Saint Augustine

data.text: If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
data.name: Jack Benny

data.text: We often repent of our first thoughts, and scarce ever of our second.
data.name: Horace Walpole

data.text: As soon go kindle fire with snow, as seek to quench the fire of love with words.
data.name: William Shakespeare

data.text: Art is the unceasing effort to compete with the beauty of flowers - and never succeeding.
data.name: Gian Carlo Menotti

data.text: Bald as the bare mountain tops are bald, with a baldness full of grandeur.
data.name: Matthew Arnold

data.text: People change and forget to tell each other.
data.name: Lillian Hellman

data.text: If you are afraid of being lonely, don't try to be right.
data.name: Jules Renard

data.text: A man is already halfway in love with any woman who listens to him.
data.name: Brendan Behan

data.text: Life is the art of drawing without an eraser.
data.name: John W. Gardner

data.text: Nature is not human hearted.
data.name: Lao Tzu

data.text: The safe way to double your money is to fold it over once and put it in your pocket.
data.name: Kin Hubbard

data.text: If you obey all the rules you miss all the fun.
data.name: Katharine Hepburn

data.text: Things work out best for those who make the best of how things work out.
data.name: John Wooden

data.text: Vision without execution is just hallucination.
data.name: Henry Ford

data.text: You can change what you are and where you are by changing what goes into your mind.
data.name: Zig Ziglar

data.text: The length of a film should be directly related to the endurance of the human bladder.
data.name: Alfred Hitchcock

data.text: If you don't know where you're going, you will probably end up somewhere else.
data.name: Laurence J. Peter

data.text: There is a woman at the beginning of all great things.
data.name: Alphonse de Lamartine

data.text: The real art of conducting consists in transitions.
data.name: Gustav Mahler

data.text: Hope is the beacon which points to prosperity.
data.name: Edward Counsel

data.text: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
data.name: John D. Rockefeller

data.text: I wish it, I command it. Let my will take the place of a reason.
data.name: Juvenal

data.text: Love does not alter the beloved, it alters itself.
data.name: Soren Kierkegaard

data.text: The more you talk about negative things in your life, the more you call them in. Speak victory not defeat.
data.name: Joel Osteen

data.text: If you run around with 9 losers pretty soon you'll be the 10th loser.
data.name: Les Brown

data.text: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
data.name: Pablo Picasso

data.text: To be prepared is half the victory.
data.name: Miguel de Cervantes

data.text: To love is to act.
data.name: Victor Hugo

data.text: All good things which exist are the fruits of originality.
data.name: John Stuart Mill

data.text: The earth is yet the place of the domicile of man and all the offspring of the first man.
data.name: Joseph Franklin Rutherford

data.text: I make mistakes; I'll be the second to admit it.
data.name: Jean Kerr

data.text: Forgiveness is a funny thing. It warms the heart and cools the sting.
data.name: William Arthur Ward

data.text: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
data.name: Emily Bronte

data.text: Art is a harmony parallel with nature.
data.name: Paul Cezanne

data.text: Winter is not a season, it's an occupation.
data.name: Sinclair Lewis

data.text: Age is something that doesn't matter, unless you are a cheese.
data.name: Luis Bunuel

data.text: There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.
data.name: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.text: The artist vocation is to send light into the human heart.
data.name: George Sand

data.text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.
data.name: Walt Whitman

data.text: Passion is more developed than discovered.
data.name: Dan Miller

data.text: My mind's my kingdom.
data.name: Francis Quarles

data.text: Love is an energy which exists of itself. It is its own value.
data.name: Thornton Wilder

data.text: The moment you cheat for the sake of beauty, you know you're an artist.
data.name: David Hockney

data.text: Conservation is a state of harmony between men and land.
data.name: Aldo Leopold

data.text: Humility is the light of understanding.
data.name: Bunyan

data.text: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.
data.name: Havelock Ellis

data.text: Fear kills more people than death.
data.name: Gen. Patton

data.text: Immature artists imitate. Mature artists steal.
data.name: Lionel Trilling

data.text: The fall of dropping water wears away the Stone.
data.name: Lucretius

data.text: The way my luck is running, if I was a politician I would be honest.
data.name: Rodney Dangerfield

data.text: Crying is for plain women. Pretty women go shopping.
data.name: Oscar Wilde

data.text: I argue thee that love is life. And life hath immortality.
data.name: Emily Dickinson

data.text: You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.
data.name: Mark Twain

data.text: Pick a flower on Earth and you move the farthest star.
data.name: Paul Dirac

data.text: Never get a mime talking. He won't stop.
data.name: Marcel Marceau

data.text: With renunciation life begins.
data.name: Amelia Barr

data.text: Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence.
data.name: Erich Fromm

data.text: Impressionism is the newspaper of the soul.
data.name: Henri Matisse

data.text: Short cuts make long delays.
data.name: J.R.R. Tolkien

data.text: A wide screen just makes a bad film twice as bad.
data.name: Samuel Goldwyn

data.text: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
data.name: John D. Rockefeller

data.text: Beauty is the lover's gift.
data.name: William Congreve

data.text: All our dreams can come true if we have the courage to pursue them.
data.name: Walt Disney

data.text: Patience and fortitude conquer all things.
data.name: Emerson

data.text: Strive not to be of success, but rather to be of value.
data.name: Einstein

data.text: The most worth while thing is to try to put happiness into the lives of others.
data.name: Robert Baden-Powell

data.text: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
data.name: Jim Rohn

data.text: An artist never really finishes his work, he merely abandons it.
data.name: Paul Valery

data.text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
data.name: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.text: Where you stand depends on where you sit.
data.name: Nelson Mandela

data.text: It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it.
data.name: Maurice Switzer

data.text: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.
data.name: Anonymous

data.text: Either you run the day, or the day runs you.
data.name: Jim Rohn

data.text: Talent wins games, but teamwork and intelligence wins championships.
data.name: Michael Jordan

data.text: Coming together is a beginning. Keeping together is progress. Working together is success.
data.name: Henry Ford

data.text: To avoid criticism, say nothing, do nothing, be nothing.
data.name: Fred Shero

data.text: A baby is God's opinion that life should go on.
data.name: Carl Sandburg

data.text: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
data.name: Milton Berle

data.text: Everything in moderation, including moderation.
data.name: Oscar Wilde

data.text: Worry is like a rocking chair, it will give you something to do, but it won't get you anywhere.
data.name: Vance Havner

data.text: Teamwork makes the dream work.
data.name: Bang Gae

data.text: The world is my country, all mankind are my brethren and to do good is my religion.
data.name: Thomas Paine

data.text: The human body is the best work of art.
data.name: Jess C. Scott

data.text: Don't count the days. Make the days count.
data.name: Muhammad Ali

data.text: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
data.name: Plato

data.text: Only you have the power to determine whether your future mimics your past.
data.name: Skip Prichard

data.text: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.
data.name: Zig Ziglar

data.text: Instead of getting married again, I'm going to find a woman I don't like and just give her a house.
data.name: Rod Stewart

data.text: Patriotism is supporting your country all the time, and your government when it deserves it.
data.name: Mark Twain

data.text: All our dreams can come true-if we have the courage to pursue them.
data.name: Walt Disney

data.text: As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so a life well spent brings happy death.
data.name: Leonardo da Vinci

data.text: Always borrow money from a pessimist. He won't expect it back.
data.name: Oscar Wilde

data.text: Courage is contagious. When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are stiffened.
data.name: Billy Graham

data.text: Patience is something you admire in the driver behind you, but not in one ahead.
data.name: Bill McGlashen

data.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
data.name: Steve Jobs

data.text: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
data.name: Mark Twain

data.text: It's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
data.name: Abraham Lincoln

data.text: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
data.name: Vince Lombardi

data.text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
data.name: Henry Stanley Haskins

data.text: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before beginning to improve the world.
data.name: Anne Frank

data.text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
data.name: Aristotle

data.text: Life isn't about getting and having, it's about giving and being.
data.name: Kevin Kruse

data.text: Waiting for perfect is never as smart as making progress.
data.name: Seth Godin

data.text: I couldn't repair your brakes, so I made your horn louder.
data.name: Steven Wright

data.text: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
data.name: Alice Walker

data.text: I have never in my life learned anything from any man who agreed with me.
data.name: Dudley Field Malone

data.text: Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune; but great minds rise above them.
data.name: Washington Irving

data.text: An unexamined life is not worth living.
data.name: Socrates

data.text: People who read the tabloids deserve to be lied to.
data.name: Jerry Seinfeld

data.text: No man is rich enough to buy back his past.
data.name: Oscar Wilde

data.text: A successful man is one who makes more money than his wife can spend. A successful woman is one who can find such a man.
data.name: Lana Turner

data.text: I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.
data.name: Charles Lamb

data.text: To the world you may be just one person, but to one person you may be the world.
data.name: Brandi Snyder

data.text: What we are is God's gift to us. What we become is our gift to God.
data.name: Eleanor Powell

data.text: He is richest who is content with the least, for contentment is the wealth of nature.
data.name: Socrates

data.text: Extreme hopes are born of extreme misery.
data.name: Bertrand Russell

data.text: The best fighter is never angry.
data.name: Lao Tzu

data.text: Hope is a good breakfast, but it is a bad supper.
data.name: Francis Bacon

data.text: Hope is a waking dream.
data.name: Aristotle

data.text: Misers aren't fun to live with, but they make wonderful ancestors.
data.name: David Brenner

data.text: Insanity is hereditary. You get it from your children.
data.name: Sam Levenson

data.text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
data.name: Steve Jobs

data.text: It wasn't raining when Noah built the ark.
data.name: Howard Ruff

data.text: Sanity and happiness are an impossible combination.
data.name: Mark Twain

data.text: Never tell your problems to anyone. 20% don't care and the other 80% are glad you have them.
data.name: Lou Holtz

data.text: There's zero correlation between being the best talker and having the best ideas.
data.name: Susan Cain

data.text: It is not fair to ask of others what you are unwilling to do yourself.
data.name: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.text: Bisexuality immediately doubles your chances for a date on Saturday night.
data.name: Rodney Dangerfield

data.text: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
data.name: John Lennon

data.text: You were born an original. Don't die a copy.
data.name: John Mason

data.text: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
data.name: Mark Twain

data.text: An archaeologist is the best husband a woman can have; the older she gets the more interested he is in her.
data.name: Agatha Christie

data.text: The dog is a gentleman; I hope to go to his heaven not man's.
data.name: Mark Twain

data.text: Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.
data.name: Robert Orben

data.text: The most difficult years of marriage are those following the wedding.
data.name: Bethany Austin

data.text: Don't smother each other. No one can grow in the shade.
data.name: Leo Buscaglia

data.text: Those people who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
data.name: Isaac Asimov

data.text: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it.
data.name: Margaret Fuller

data.text: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
data.name: Alan Kay

data.text: If not us, who? If not now, when?
data.name: Hillel the Elder

data.text: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
data.name: Mark Twain

data.text: The best revenge is massive success.
data.name: Frank Sinatra

data.text: A bargain is something you don't need at a price you can't resist.
data.name: Franklin Jones

data.text: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
data.name: Robert Brault

data.text: Remember that happiness is a way of travel, not a destination.
data.name: Roy L. Goodman

data.text: Certain things catch your eye, but pursue only those that capture the heart.
data.name: Ancient Indian Proverb

data.text: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
data.name: Helen Keller

data.text: There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them.
data.name: Denis Waitley

data.text: The trouble with being punctual is that nobody's there to appreciate it.
data.name: Franklin P. Jones

data.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
data.name: Theodore Roosevelt

data.text: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
data.name: George Addair

data.text: Before I got married I had six theories about bringing up children; now I have six children and no theories.
data.name: John Wilmot

data.text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
data.name: George Eliot

data.text: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
data.name: Pablo Picasso

data.text: The only mystery in life is why the kamikaze pilots wore helmets.
data.name: Al McGuire

data.text: Don't walk in front of me, I may not follow. Don't walk behind me, I may not lead. Just walk beside me and be my friend.
data.name: Anonymous

data.text: No one has ever become poor by giving.
data.name: Anne Frank

data.text: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
data.name: Oscar Wilde

data.text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
data.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.text: Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened.
data.name: Theodor Seuss Geisel

data.text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
data.name: Oscar Wilde

data.text: Two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I am not yet completely sure about the universe.
data.name: Albert Einstein

data.text: You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams.
data.name: Theodor Seuss Geisel

data.text: This is the first test of a gentleman: his respect for those who can be of no possible value to him.
data.name: William Lyon Phelps

data.text: Unless we stand for something, we shall fall for anything.
data.name: Peter Marshall

data.text: It is our choices . . . that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
data.name: J. K. Rowling

data.text: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
data.name: William Shakespeare

data.text: Fairy tales are more than true-not because they tell us dragons exist, but because they tell us dragons can be beaten.
data.name: Neil Gaiman

data.text: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
data.name: Albert Einstein

data.text: Don't look for big things, just do small things with great love.
data.name: Mother Teresa

data.text: A ship ought not to be held by one anchor, nor life by a single hope.
data.name: Epictetus

data.text: Without music, life would be a mistake.
data.name: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

data.text: I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying.
data.name: Oscar Wilde

data.text: A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you.
data.name: Elbert Hubbard

data.text: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
data.name: Mark Twain

data.text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
data.name: Oscar Wilde

data.text: You must be the change that you wish to see in the world.
data.name: Mahatma Gandhi

data.text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
data.name: Mae West

data.text: The cave you fear to enter holds the treasure you seek.
data.name: Joseph Campbell

data.text: God gave us our relatives; thank God we can choose our friends.
data.name: Ethel Mumford

data.text: In the arithmetic of love, one plus one equals everything, and two minus one equals nothing.
data.name: Mignon McLaughlin

data.text: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.
data.name: Wayne Walter Dyer

data.text: Going to church doesn't make you a Christian any more than standing in a garage makes you a car.
data.name: Billy Sunday

data.text: There is nothing wrong with America that cannot be cured by what is right with America.
data.name: Bill Clinton

data.text: The only foolproof path to wealth is inheritance.
data.name: David Gardner

data.text: A diplomat is someone who can tell you to go to hell in such a way that you will look forward to the trip.
data.name: Caskie Stinnett

data.text: Life consists not in holding good cards but in playing those you hold well.
data.name: Josh Billings

data.text: To love and win is the best thing. To love and lose, the next best.
data.name: William Makepeace Thackeray

data.text: I'm at the age where I want two girls. In case I fall asleep they will have someone to talk to.
data.name: Rodney Dangerfield

data.text: There is more hunger for love and appreciation in this world than for bread.
data.name: Mother Teresa

data.text: By working faithfully eight hours a day you may eventually get to be boss and work twelve hours a day.
data.name: Robert Frost

data.text: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
data.name: Thomas Edison

data.text: My favorite machine at the gym is the vending machine.
data.name: Caroline Rhea

data.text: Love me when I least deserve it, because that's when I really need it.
data.name: Swedish Proverb

data.text: I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning how to sail my ship.
data.name: Louisa May Alcott

data.text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen nor even touched, but just felt in the heart.
data.name: Anne Sullivan

data.text: We need not think alike to love alike.
data.name: Francis David

data.text: I grew up with six brothers. That's how I learned to dance-waiting for the bathroom.
data.name: Bob Hope

data.text: In matters of style, swim with the current; in matters of principle, stand like a rock.
data.name: Thomas Jefferson

data.text: Never argue with stupid people, they will drag you down to their level and then beat you with experience.
data.name: Mark Twain

data.text: Do not hire a man who does your work for money, but him who does it for love of it.
data.name: Henry David Thoreau

data.text: I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by.
data.name: Douglas Adams

data.text: Challenge yourself with something you know you could never do, and what you'll find is that you can overcome anything.
data.name: Anonymous

data.text: My opinions may have changed, but not the fact that I am right.
data.name: Ashleigh Brilliant

data.text: You cannot shake hands with a clenched fist.
data.name: Indira Gandhi

data.text: Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that.
data.name: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.text: The madness of love is the greatest of heaven's blessings.
data.name: Plato

data.text: If you want to test your memory, try to recall what you were worrying about one year ago today.
data.name: E. Joseph Cossman

data.text: Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn't.
data.name: Erica Jong

data.text: The man who has confidence in himself gains the confidence of others.
data.name: Hasidic Proverb

data.text: The real opportunity for success lies within the person and not in the job.
data.name: Zig Ziglar

data.text: Stop wearing your wishbone where your backbone ought to be.
data.name: Elizabeth Gilbert

data.text: There is nothing so annoying as to have two people go right on talking when you're interrupting.
data.name: Mark Twain

data.text: I don't know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody.
data.name: Bill Cosby

data.text: Love is friendship set on fire.
data.name: Jeremy Taylor

data.text: It takes a great deal of courage to stand up to your enemies, but even more to stand up to your friends.
data.name: J. K. Rowling

data.text: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.
data.name: Peter F. Drucker
